Broadcaster.brief: A flexible event router that attaches to component values, properties, module parameters, complex data, mouse events, and other sources to dispatch messages to registered listener callbacks.

seeAlso.distinction: Broadcaster routes events within a single script (component values, module parameters, mouse events), while GlobalCable is a named value bus for cross-project or cross-script value routing with OSC integration.
Broadcaster fires callbacks in response to state changes from attached sources, while Timer fires a callback at a fixed periodic interval regardless of external state.
Broadcaster can attach to arbitrary UI/module sources, while TransportHandler specifically reacts to host transport events (tempo, play/stop, beat, time signature).

ErrorHandler.brief: Intercepts system-level error events (missing samples, audio dropouts, license issues) and routes them to a scripting callback for custom error UI instead of the default overlay.

seeAlso.distinction: ErrorHandler is specifically for system error events with predefined error levels, while Broadcaster is a general-purpose event dispatcher for arbitrary script-level sources.

TransportHandler.brief: Registers callbacks for host transport events including tempo changes, play/stop state, time signature changes, beat positions, and a high-precision grid timer synced to the DAW timeline.

seeAlso.distinction: TransportHandler fires callbacks in response to host transport events (tempo, play/stop, beat position), while Timer fires at a fixed millisecond interval independent of the DAW.
TransportHandler is dedicated to host transport state (tempo, playback, grid), while Broadcaster can attach to arbitrary component, module, or data sources.

Timer.brief: A periodic timer that fires a callback on the message thread at a configurable millisecond interval, used for UI polling and delayed actions.

seeAlso.distinction: Timer fires at a fixed millisecond interval for general-purpose polling, while TransportHandler fires callbacks synced to the host transport (tempo, beat, grid).
Timer fires periodically on the message thread for UI updates, while BackgroundTask runs a one-shot or long-running function on a background thread.
Timer fires at a fixed interval regardless of state changes, while Broadcaster fires when an attached source (component value, module parameter, etc.) changes.

Threads.brief: Provides thread-awareness utilities for querying thread identity, lock state, and safely executing functions on the loading thread after suspending audio processing.

seeAlso.distinction: Threads provides query methods for thread state and a single killVoicesAndCall utility, while BackgroundTask is a concrete task handle for running code on a dedicated background thread with progress tracking.

BackgroundTask.brief: A task handle for running long operations (downloads, processing, OS processes) on a background thread with progress reporting, abort signaling, and thread-safe property storage.

seeAlso.distinction: BackgroundTask runs a one-shot or long-running function on a background thread, while Timer fires a periodic callback on the message thread for UI polling.
BackgroundTask is a concrete task handle with progress tracking and abort control, while Threads is a utility namespace for querying thread identity and lock state.

GlobalRoutingManager.brief: A singleton manager for the global cable routing system that creates and retrieves named GlobalCable instances and provides OSC send/receive integration for external controller communication.

seeAlso.distinction: GlobalRoutingManager is the factory that creates/retrieves GlobalCable instances and manages OSC connections, while GlobalCable is the individual named value bus you send and receive values through.
GlobalRoutingManager provides cross-project named value buses with OSC integration, while Broadcaster routes events between components and modules within a single script.

GlobalCable.brief: A named value bus for routing normalised or ranged values between scripts, modules, macro controls, and external OSC sources, with support for synchronous (audio-thread-safe) and asynchronous callbacks.

seeAlso.distinction: GlobalCable is a named value bus for cross-project routing with OSC and macro integration, while Broadcaster attaches to specific component/module sources for script-level event dispatch.
GlobalCable is the individual value bus you interact with, while GlobalRoutingManager is the factory that creates cables and manages OSC connections.
